name: Git
title: This cheat sheet summarizes commonly used Git command line instructions for quick reference.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This cheat sheet summarizes commonly used Git command line instructions for quick reference.

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Clone a repository

```shell script
$ git clone git_url

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Clone a repository into a specified directory

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
### Make a change {.row-span-2}

Show modified files in working directory, staged for your next commit

```shell script
$ git status

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Stages the file, ready for commit

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Stage all changed files, ready for commit

```shell script
$ git add .

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Commit all staged files to version history

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Commit all your tracked files to version history

```shell script
$ git commit -am "commit message"

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Discard changes in working directory which is not staged

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Unstage a staged file or file which is staged

```shell script
$ git restore --staged [file]

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Unstage a file, keeping the file changes

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Revert everything to the last commit

```shell script
$ git reset --hard

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Diff of what is changed but not staged

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Diff of what is staged but not yet committed

```shell script
$ git diff --staged

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Apply any commits of current branch ahead of specified one

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
### Configuration

Set the name that will be attached to your commits and tags

```shell script
$ git config --global user.name "name"

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Set an email address that will be attached to your commits and tags

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Enable some colorization of Git output

```shell script
$ git config --global color.ui auto

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Edit the global configuration file in a text editor

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
### Working with Branches

List all local branches

```shell script
$ git branch

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: List all branches, local and remote

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Switch to my_branch, and update working directory

```shell script
$ git checkout my_branch

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body: Create a new branch called new_branch

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Delete the branch called my_branch

```shell script
$ git branch -d my_branch

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.body:
```shell script
$ git checkout branchB
$ git merge branchA

cards.title: Create a Repository
cards.code:
Tag the current commit

```shell script
$ git tag my_tag

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.body: Show the commit history for the currently active branch

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.code:
Show the commits on branchA that are not on branchB

```shell script
$ git log branchB..branchA

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.body: Show the commits that changed file, even across renames

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.code:
Show the diff of what is in branchA that is not in branchB

```shell script
$ git diff branchB...branchA

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.body: Show any object in Git in human-readable format

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.code:
### Synchronize

Fetch down all the branches from that Git remote

```shell script
$ git fetch [alias]

cards.title: Observe your Repository
cards.body: Merge a remote branch into your current branch to bring it up to date

cards.title: Only fast-forward
cards.code:
Transmit local branch commits to the remote repository branch

```shell script
$ git push [alias] [branch]

cards.title: Only fast-forward
cards.body: Fetch and merge any commits from the tracking remote branch

cards.title: Only fast-forward
cards.code:
Merge just one specific commit from another branch to your current branch

```shell script
$ git cherry-pick [commit_id]

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Add a git URL as an alias

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
Show the names of the remote repositories you've set up

```shell script
$ git remote

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Show the names and URLs of the remote repositories

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
Remove a remote repository

```shell script
$ git remote rm [remote repo name]

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Change the URL of the git repo

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
### Temporary Commits

Save modified and staged changes

```shell script
$ git stash

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: List stack-order of stashed file changes

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
Write working from top of stash stack

```shell script
$ git stash pop

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Discard the changes from top of stash stack

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
### Tracking path Changes

Delete the file from project and stage the removal for commit

```shell script
$ git rm [file]

cards.title: Remote
cards.body: Change an existing file path and stage the move

cards.title: Remote
cards.code:
Show all commit logs with indication of any paths that moved

```shell script
$ git log --stat -M

cards.title: Ignoring Files
cards.code:
/logs/*

# "!" means don't ignore
!logs/.gitkeep

/# Ignore Mac system files
.DS_store

# Ignore node_modules folder
node_modules

# Ignore SASS config files
.sass-cache

cards.title: Ignoring Files
cards.body: A `.gitignore` file specifies intentionally untracked files that Git should ignore

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
- #### **Push** and reset
  ```shell script
  $ git push origin -u <new_name>

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
{.marker-timeline}

### Log

Search change by content

```shell script
$ git log -S'<a term in the source>'

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Show changes over time for specific file

cards.title: Rename branch
Rename branch
cards.body: List files changed in a commit

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
List files changed in commits excluding merges

```shell script
$ git log --no-merges --name-only

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Limit commits to the last N entries

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Limit commits to the last N entries (alternate syntax) 

```shell script
$ git log -n <number>

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Limit commits to a maximum of N entries

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Show commits more recent than a specific date 

```shell script
$ git log --after="YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS ±HHMM"

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Show commits older than a specific date

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Filter commits by author matching a pattern 

```shell script
$ git log --author=<pattern>

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Filter commits by commit message matching a pattern

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Show commit graph of the current branch with reference decorations

```shell script
$ git log --graph --decorate

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Show commit graph of a specific branch without switching to it

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Show commit graph for commits in one branch not in another

```shell script
$ git log --graph --decorate <branchB>..<branchA>

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Show commit graph of all branches

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
### Branch {.row-span-2}

List all branches and their upstreams

```shell script
$ git branch -vv

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Quickly switch to the previous branch

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
Get only remote branches

```shell script
$ git branch -r

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Checkout a single file from another branch

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
### Rewriting history

Rewrite last commit message

```shell script
$ git commit --amend -m "new message"

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.body: Amend the latest commit without changing the commit message.

cards.title: Rename branch
cards.code:
See also: [Rewriting history](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/rewriting-history)

### Git Aliases

```cmd
git config --global alias.co checkout
git config --global alias.br branch
git config --global alias.ci commit
git config --global alias.st status

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.body: Create a new working tree at the specified path. If a branch is specified, it checks out that branch. If no branch is given, a new one is created based on HEAD and named after the new directory.

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.code:
List all of the active working trees associated with the repository.

```shell script
$ git worktree list

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.code:
Clean up stale or manually deleted working trees.

```shell script
$ git worktree prune

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.body: Relocate the working tree to a new path.

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.code:
### Submodules

Create a new submodule within your repository:

```shell script
$ git submodule add <repository_url> <path>

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.body: Clone a repository and initialize its submodules:

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.code:
Update all the submodules in your repository to the latest commit of their respective branches:

```shell script
$ git submodule update

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.body: Pull the latest changes from the remote repositories of the submodules and update them in your main repository:

cards.title: Worktrees
cards.code:
Remove a submodule from your repository:

```shell script
$ git submodule deinit <path>
$ git rm <path>
$ git commit -m "Removed submodule"

cards.title: Cherry-picking
cards.body: Cherry-picking allows you to apply a specific commit from one branch to another branch.

cards.title: Cherry-picking
cards.code:
### Reflog

Display the reflog, showing the history of HEAD and branch movements:

```shell script
$ git reflog

cards.title: Cherry-picking
cards.body: Find the hash of the lost commit or branch using the reflog and then checkout to that hash to restore it:
